title: For Sale:  Russian Tula SKS Rifle
postcontent: The SKS carbine is one of the best, most reliable battle carbines ever designed. Chambered for the potent and accurate 7.62X39 cartridge it was used throughout the Soviet Union and all their client countries and has been shot at just about every free nation’s troops around the world (including this writer). There’s a host of aftermarket items available for it including high capacity detachable magazines, folding stocks, bull pup stocks, flash hiders, scope mounts, accessory rails and much more. It features a chromed bore, 10 round magazine, fully adjustable sights and folding blade bayonet and hardwood stock. This CAI imported example was made in the Tula arsenal and is like-new, with  cleaning rod, combination tool & brush (in butt trap), and is NOT an arsenal rebuild. All serial numbers match (receiver, bolt, cover, stock, magazine & trigger group), the build date is 1954 and you’re not likely to ever see one of these in better original condition. It retains 98+% blue while the bore is perfect (new), while the stock is completely sound with only a smattering of light handling marks. The bolt face shows no evidence of this carbine having been fired and while we’re not asserting that this is un-fired, we wouldn’t be surprised if it was. As a side note: we’ve never seen an SKS with such carful polishing of both the blued and bright metal surfaces – quite uncharacteristic for the Red’s (and there is no doubt that this is the original finish). With an abundance of very reasonably priced ammo available it’s a great carbine for plinking fun or serious defense. Or, in the case of this example, a collectable asset that’s bound to appreciate.
